00:00:06:120000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:06:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:07:120000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:07:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:07:120000.Dialogue: I can't comment without violating our agreement that I not criticize your work.

00:00:12:200000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:12:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:14:180000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:14:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:18:060000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:18:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:18:060000.Dialogue: There's nothing wrong with the science here.

00:00:20:130000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:20:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:20:130000.Dialogue: Perhaps you mean a different thing than I do when you say, Science.

00:00:32:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:32:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:33:180000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:33:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:33:180000.Dialogue: You actually had it right in the first place.

00:00:37:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:37:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:37:150000.Dialogue: Once again, you've fallen for one of my classic pranks.

00:00:41:210000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:41:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:48:150000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:48:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:48:150000.Dialogue: Now here's a peculiar e-mail. The president of the university wants me to meet him at his office tomorrow morning at 8:00 a.m.

00:00:55:010000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:00:55:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:04:130000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:01:04:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:04:130000.Dialogue: Yes, how did we live before Twitter?

00:01:09:030000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:01:09:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:09:030000.Dialogue: I guess you'll find out what it is in the morning.

00:01:11:190000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:01:11:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:11:190000.Dialogue: That's 14 hours away. For the next 840 minutes, I'm effectively one of Heisenberg's particles; I know where I am or I know how fast I'm going, but I can't know both. Yet how am I supposed to carry on with this huge annoying thing hovering over my head?

00:01:26:140000.Scene: The apartment. Leonard is working on a whiteboard.
00:01:26:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:59:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:59:120000.Dialogue: Why does everybody keep telling me what time it is?

00:02:09:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:09:070000.Dialogue: That entire family is fascinated by what time it is and whether people know it.

00:02:14:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:14:160000.Dialogue: You went to President Seibert's house in the middle of the night?

00:02:17:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:17:170000.Dialogue: He didn't respond to my e-mail, his phone number is unlisted. Tell me what my other option was.

00:02:23:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:23:090000.Dialogue: You could have waited until morning. I know, look who I'm talking to.

00:02:30:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:30:000000.Dialogue: Do you remember the grant proposal I submitted to the National Science Foundation to detect slow-moving monopoles at the magnetic North Pole?

00:02:37:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:37:030000.Dialogue: Hardly a day goes by when I don't think about it.

00:02:40:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:40:230000.Dialogue: How nice. Well, a space opened up at the last minute on the NSF expedition to the Arctic Circle.

00:02:53:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:53:090000.Dialogue: He offered to send you to the North Pole?

00:02:55:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:55:210000.Dialogue: In fact, he was quite enthusiastic.

00:02:58:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:58:160000.Dialogue: He said, Frankly, if I could send you tonight, I would.

00:03:03:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:03:220000.Dialogue: Okay, well, do you want to go?

00:03:06:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:06:020000.Dialogue: Of course not. I'm a theoretical physicist. A career I chose in no small part because it's indoors,

00:03:13:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:13:130000.Dialogue: but if I'm able to detect slow-moving magnetic monopoles there, I will be the scientis to confirm string theory. People will write books about me. Third-graders will create macaroni-art dioramas depicting scenes from my life.

00:03:28:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:28:020000.Dialogue: Sure, maybe a tableau of me trying to pummel you to death.

00:03:37:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:37:080000.Dialogue: I'm on the horns of a dilemma. Can you imagine me, Sheldon Cooper, at the North Pole?

00:03:43:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:43:110000.Dialogue: Easy peasy, I'm doing it right now.

00:03:47:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:47:010000.Dialogue: I'm not good with cold. How often have we had to leave a movie theater because I got a headache from drinking the Icee too fast?

00:03:59:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:59:170000.Dialogue: The scientific opportunity of a lifetime presents itself and my best friend says Don't go.

00:04:11:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:11:180000.Dialogue: What are the words I can say right now to end this conversation and let me go back to sleep?

00:04:16:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:16:160000.Dialogue: Odd, President Seibert posed the exact same question.

00:04:30:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:30:210000.Dialogue: Just imagine. If he says yes, we'll have an entire summer without Sheldon.

00:04:41:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:41:010000.Dialogue: We could sit on the left side of the couch.

00:04:44:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:44:030000.Dialogue: I could use the bathroom at 8:20.

00:04:50:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:50:170000.Dialogue: Our dreams are very small, aren't they?

00:04:55:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:55:090000.Dialogue: Good news, gentlemen, I have tentatively accepted...

00:05:05:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:05:030000.Dialogue: ... the invitation to join the Arctic Expedition.

00:05:08:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:08:120000.Dialogue: It's not gonna be the same without you.

00:05:11:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:11:180000.Dialogue: Thank you, but your sentiments may be premature.

00:05:15:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:15:110000.Dialogue: I don't like where this is going.

00:05:18:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:18:030000.Dialogue: I would like to propose... that the three of you accompany me.

00:05:27:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:27:040000.Dialogue: Is this just so we won't touch your stuff while you're away?

00:05:31:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:31:220000.Dialogue: I'll admit that was a concern.

00:05:34:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:34:130000.Dialogue: But the fact is, I'll need a support team. And the three of you are my first choice.

00:05:40:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:40:100000.Dialogue: There are others who might be more qualified, but the thought of interviewing them gave me a stomachache.

00:05:45:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:45:200000.Dialogue: I know I'm proposing an enormous undertaking. So, why don't you take a few moments to discuss it?

00:05:53:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:53:130000.Dialogue: We're not really gonna go to the North Pole with him, are we?

00:05:59:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:59:150000.Dialogue: You may want to wait for my door to close.

00:06:04:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:04:050000.Dialogue: We're not really gonna go to the North Pole with him, are we?

00:06:07:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:07:010000.Dialogue: Hang on. Let's talk about it. This is a National Science Foundation expedition. I don't know how we can turn it down.

00:06:13:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:13:210000.Dialogue: Easy. Instead of saying, No, we don't want to go on an NSF expedition, say, No, we don't want to spend three months stuck in a cabin in the Arctic Circle with an anal nutbag.

00:06:24:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:24:060000.Dialogue: But if we were part of the team that confirmed string theory, we could drink for free in any bar in any college town with a university that has a strong science program.

00:06:35:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:35:150000.Dialogue: Howard, this is big science. You could be the engineer who builds the equipment that puts us on the cover of magazines.

00:06:41:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:41:220000.Dialogue: I could also be the engineer who builds the crossbow that kills Sheldon.

00:06:50:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:50:110000.Dialogue: You still might get on a magazine.

00:06:54:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:54:080000.Dialogue: So you guys are seriously considering this? - You think you can put up with Sheldon?

00:06:57:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:57:230000.Dialogue: - Well, I'm a Hindu. My religion teaches that if we suffer in this life we are rewarded in the next. Three months at the North Pole with Sheldon, and I'm reborn as a well-hung billionaire with wings!

00:07:20:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:20:170000.Dialogue: Well, gentlemen, have you reached a decision?

00:07:32:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:32:020000.Dialogue: Excellent. Just an FYI, as I am the expedition's team leader, protocol dictates that be phrased, Fine, sir.

00:07:39:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:39:110000.Dialogue: But don't worry, there will be a briefing.

00:08:13:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:13:220000.Dialogue: I need access to the Cheesecake Factory's walk-in freezer.

00:08:17:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:17:070000.Dialogue: Honey, I already told you, the hamburger meat is fresh and stored at a safe temperature.

00:08:23:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:23:200000.Dialogue: This is to train for a three-month expedition to the magnetic North Pole.

00:08:29:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:29:230000.Dialogue: I don't know how that sentence could possibly confuse you...

00:08:35:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:35:060000.Dialogue: but to elaborate, I'm going to the Arctic Circle with Leonard, Wolowitz and Koothrappali.

00:08:48:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:48:000000.Dialogue: Is that a yes or a no on the freezer? That woman has the attention span of a gnat.

00:08:55:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:55:080000.Dialogue: Sheldon says you're going to the North Pole.

00:08:59:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:59:050000.Dialogue: Yeah. I'm just a little surprised you didn't tell me.

00:09:02:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:02:030000.Dialogue: It all happened kind of fast. And we had to get physicals and buy thermal underwear and study up on, you know, snow and stuff.

00:09:11:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:11:110000.Dialogue: Sorry, I was gonna tell you.

00:09:13:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:13:070000.Dialogue: You don't have to apologize. There's no reason you have to tell me. I was just... you know, surprised.

00:09:18:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:18:080000.Dialogue: You were busy, you were surprised, all very fascinating. Now where do we stand on the freezer?

00:09:27:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:27:210000.Dialogue: All right, I'll see what I can do. So, three months at the North Pole. That is... awesome.

00:09:36:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:36:230000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, but at what point do you put this see what you can do plan into action?

00:09:43:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:43:090000.Dialogue: Just a warning, Sheldon... The freezer locks from the outside.

00:09:52:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:52:190000.Dialogue: Did she seem upset to you? Did she seem upset to you?

00:10:10:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:10:040000.Dialogue: I know she's not my girlfriend or anything, but wouldn't you think she'd feel a little bad that I'm going to be gone for the whole summer?

00:10:16:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:16:180000.Dialogue: That feels like a bonus question.

00:10:20:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:20:070000.Dialogue: I'm going to stop here while I'm ahead, but I've had a great time.

00:10:35:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:35:150000.Dialogue: the purpose of this drill is to acclimate us to the use of tools in extreme temperatures such as we will face in the Arctic Circle.

00:10:47:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:47:100000.Dialogue: All right, team, open up your practice kits. As the university did not permit me to bring the actual equipment we'll be using to the Cheesecake Factory, because apparently, I'm ridiculous,

00:10:58:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:58:110000.Dialogue: I've provided substitutes which will exercise your fine motor skills. Leonard, you will be doing a series of complex mathematical problems on a vintage Casio model 1175 calculator watch I received when I won the Earth Science medal in 3rd grade.

00:11:17:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:17:120000.Dialogue: Raj, you will be painting sideburns and a Van Dyke on a six-inch figurine of Legolas the elf.

00:11:25:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:25:010000.Dialogue: Now, remember, a Van Dyke is a goatee without a mustache.

00:11:30:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:30:040000.Dialogue: Wolowitz, you will be completing a series of delicate surgical procedures on the classic children's game Operation.

00:11:41:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:41:010000.Dialogue: To begin with, you will remove funny bone for two hundred dollars.

00:11:48:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:48:100000.Dialogue: For this I went to MIT.

00:11:58:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:58:000000.Dialogue: I think I swallowed some paint!

00:12:00:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:00:210000.Dialogue: I can't press any of the buttons with my gloves. Son of a bitch!

00:12:07:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:07:180000.Dialogue: Adversity is to be expected. Continue.

00:12:11:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:11:020000.Dialogue: Oh, boy, am I gonna get sued.

00:12:17:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:17:060000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, use your imagination. Innovate. Did Han Solo let Luke Skywalker freeze to death on the ice planet of Hoth?

00:12:25:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:25:220000.Dialogue: He cut open a tauntaun and used its internal body heat to warm him up.

00:12:30:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:30:150000.Dialogue: You heard the man. Hold him down and I'll cut him open.

00:12:33:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:33:100000.Dialogue: Hang on, I know I don't possess the tools of leadership, but why can't we assemble the equipment inside the hut and then take it outside?

00:13:03:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:03:210000.Dialogue: In the frigid temperatures in the Arctic, we need to consume at least 5,000 calories a day just to maintain our body weight.

00:13:10:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:10:010000.Dialogue: You know I can't eat butter. I'm lactose intolerant.

00:13:12:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:12:160000.Dialogue: Way ahead of you, that's an I Can't Believe It's Not Butter stick.

00:13:16:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:16:210000.Dialogue: But Mummy, all the other guys are going to the North Pole.

00:13:19:190000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:13:19:190000.Dialogue: I don't care what the other guys are doing. If the other guys jumped in the Bay of Bengal and tried to swim to Sri Lanka, would you follow them?

00:13:27:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:27:040000.Dialogue: If you were standing behind me nagging, I might.

00:13:30:180000.Speaker: Dr Koothrappali
00:13:30:180000.Dialogue: Don't talk back to your mother. This trip is much too dangerous.

00:13:34:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:34:140000.Dialogue: No, it's not. Howard, tell them.

00:13:42:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:42:160000.Dialogue: I understand your concern, but if it'll make you feel any better, my mother is fine with me going, and it's a woman who kept a safety rail on my bed until I was 17.

00:13:52:060000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:13:52:060000.Dialogue: So, she has no problem with her son being eaten by a walrus?

00:13:56:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:56:040000.Dialogue: That's very unlikely, Mrs. Koothrappali. If Raj dies, it'll be from frostbite, gangrene, acute sunburn or being ripped to shreds by a 1,500 pound polar bear.

00:14:06:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:06:100000.Dialogue: Ma, I'm putting you on speakerphone with Raj's parents. Can you tell them that you're okay with me going to the Arctic?

00:14:13:070000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:14:13:070000.Dialogue: Arctic?! I thought you said Arkansas!

00:14:19:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:19:030000.Dialogue: I didn't say that. You never listen to me!

00:14:21:170000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:14:21:170000.Dialogue: He doesn't tell me anything! He lives a secret life because he's ashamed!

00:14:28:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:28:160000.Dialogue: Can I talk to you for a sec?

00:14:30:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:30:090000.Dialogue: Sure, but let's go out here where there's a little less yelling and guilt.

00:14:37:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:37:080000.Dialogue: Well, I got you a little going away present.

00:14:52:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:52:140000.Dialogue: So, you can be all snoodled up while you do your science stuff.

00:15:17:070000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:15:17:070000.Dialogue: I told you no! Why don't you believe me?

00:15:20:100000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:15:20:100000.Dialogue: 'Cause it doesn't make sense to me! How can it be that in the entire country of India, there isn't one Outback Steakhouse?!

00:15:39:070000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:15:39:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:44:020000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:15:44:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:45:080000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:15:45:080000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:49:120000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:15:49:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:49:120000.Dialogue: I don't know if I can go on the expedition. What? I don't think I can go to the North Pole.

00:15:57:190000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:15:57:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:57:190000.Dialogue: I know you're concerned about disappointing me but I want you to take comfort from the knowledge that my expectations of you are very low.

00:16:08:010000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:08:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:10:050000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:10:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:10:050000.Dialogue: Comforting is a part of leadership. It's not a part I care for, but such is my burden.

00:16:15:140000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:15:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:15:140000.Dialogue: Terrific, it's just that... I don't think Penny wants me to go.

00:16:19:140000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:19:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:19:140000.Dialogue: Assuming that's a valid reason not to go, which it isn't... How do you know this? Did she say it?

00:16:26:230000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:26:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:26:230000.Dialogue: Not exactly. But she said she was gonna miss me and she gave me this.

00:16:35:000000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:35:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:38:070000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:38:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:42:130000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:42:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:42:130000.Dialogue: Let me see if I understand correctly. Her missing you is an emotional state you find desirable?

00:16:49:100000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:49:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:51:000000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:51:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:51:000000.Dialogue: Well, given that missing you is predicated on you leaving, logic dictates you must leave.

00:16:59:180000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:16:59:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:59:180000.Dialogue: Yes, okay, but I'm gonna be gone for three months. What if she doesn't miss me that long and she meets someone else?

00:17:06:180000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:06:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:06:180000.Dialogue: She does have a short attention span.

00:17:10:020000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:10:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:11:140000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:11:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:11:140000.Dialogue: Leonard, you may be right. It appears that Penny secretly wants you in her life in a very intimate and carnal fashion.

00:17:19:150000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:19:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:24:190000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:24:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:24:190000.Dialogue: Even in my sleep-deprived state, I've managed to pull off another one of my classic pranks.

00:17:30:200000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is asleep. There is a knock on the door.
00:17:30:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:40:210000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:17:40:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:40:210000.Dialogue: - It's 7:00 a.m. I'm sorry it's early, but we're leaving soon, and I needed to talk to you. What did you mean when you said you were going to miss me?

00:17:53:060000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:17:53:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:53:060000.Dialogue: I don't know. You'll be gone and I'll notice.

00:18:00:140000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:00:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:00:140000.Dialogue: What about this? What does this mean?

00:18:04:060000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:04:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:04:060000.Dialogue: Wine, credit card and late night television are a bad combination.

00:18:10:130000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:10:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:10:130000.Dialogue: All right, fine. What about that really long hug? What did that mean?

00:18:15:210000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:15:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:17:220000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:17:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:17:220000.Dialogue: It was at least five Mississippis.

00:18:22:080000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:22:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:22:080000.Dialogue: A standard hug is two Mississippis tops.

00:18:28:110000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:28:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:28:110000.Dialogue: Leonard, I don't know what to tell you. It was just a hug.

00:18:32:120000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:32:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:34:150000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:34:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:35:230000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:35:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:39:200000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard is knocking.
00:18:39:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:39:200000.Dialogue: - Okay, bye. It means I wish you weren't going.

00:19:03:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:03:020000.Dialogue: All right, we begin initial assembly and deployment of the testing equipment starting tomorrow at 0700 hours, but until then, you are all off duty. I suggest you keep the shenanigans to a minimum as medical help is 18 hours away by dogsled.

00:19:25:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:25:010000.Dialogue: Hey, guys, can I just say something? How about we take a moment to think about where we are right now? This is literally the top of the world. Only a handful of people in all of human history will ever see what we are going to see.

00:19:45:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:45:030000.Dialogue: So, who's up for a movie?

00:19:47:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:47:030000.Dialogue: Good idea, what do you think? Ice Station Zebra or John Carpenter's The Thing?

00:19:59:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:59:160000.Dialogue: Did you bring the dehydrated low-sodium soy sauce? - Freeze-dried spicy mustard? - Check. Flash-frozen brown rice, not white?

00:20:10:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:10:070000.Dialogue: Not to worry. I hid it.

00:20:32:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:32:030000.Dialogue: There's no time for a crossbow. Find me an icicle.

00:20:39:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:39:050000.Dialogue: Three months. This is gonna be great.
